page.lettertext:
fol.145r
Bel
gia bis
15
94
10
July
Maye it please your good L: I have nothing more to signifie for myne
owne negotiation, till I heare from your L: It might have steeded me
muche for many respectes, if untill
at her
Ma
tie
had fully resolved,
I might either have knowne, by some little intimation, wherupon
it hath stayed, or had somewhat saide unto me, to intertayne
them heere the whyle: For although I have devised the beste
at
I could to aunswear their demandes, yet I see they are
not
satisfied, and
I am alwayes uncerten, how well my aunswers maye accorde with
her Ma
ties
designes. It is signified very now by l
re
s from
e
Campe,
at
e fift of this moneth, a parte of
e Ravelin where our
soldiers had mined, and placed stoare of powder, was sette a fyre,
and blowen up, with 200 men in it, of which there were very
fewe saved, but either by
e Mine or by our men after slaine, and
manie of
em drowned in
e water fast by. The Ravelin there-
upon was presently assaulted, and taken by
e Scottes, whose quar-
ter was neerest, which is thought a great stoppe to
e taking of
e
Towne.
And we hope in lyke manner to heare everie hower of
some speciall attempt to be given besides, For our approches, Galleries
other Mynes, and Workes, are brought soe neere unto
e Rampers
in 5 or 6 places, as they were ready it is thought about 4 dayes
paste, to give upon
e Towne in all those places at an instant,
as in
e meane season having planted their Artillerie, upon 9 or
10 beddes in severall places,
at shoote daye and night, and kill
very many.
Co: Maurice
in gooing about to view
e workes
was defended from a bullet, by
e meanes of his Target, of which
a splinter brake out, and hurt his Page staunding by.
The weather heere for this moneth hath been exceeding wette,
and windie which hath been a great hinderance to
e advantage
of our workes. It is thought
at otherwise before this we might
have caried
e Towne. This benefitte we have only
at
e Marishes
therby are waxed very deepe, soe as
e Enemie hath noe meanes
to convey in any soldiers, which he did oftentymes before.
There is a speeche
at 400 of
Verdugoes
Soldiers have mutined,
and have left hym.
Ernestus
we heare doth assemble all his
forces for some speciall purpose, which is unknowne yet heere,
but onely by conjecture, having sent already to
e Castle of
Wo
adjoyning to
Berghen
3 00 mariners, It is supposed he intends
fol.145v
upon
e Ile of
Tertol
. It is advertised hither from
e Enem
ies
Contrey,
at
e
Co: Charles Mansfelt
, is gon to
e Spawe, leaving
most
of his Troupes between
Arras
and
Douay
. The bruite goeth heere
,
at
e
Prince of Anhalt
is come to Co: Maurice, as they saye but to
see
and salute him. But by reason of a secreat motion which hath
bin
made by frindes heeretofore, for a matche betweene
e Prince
and
e
Lady Emilia de Nassau
Co: Maurices sister, both by
father
a
nd
mother,
it is supposed
at his co
m
ing is chiefly for that. But fo
r ought
I can perceave, by talke with those
at seeme to know yt,
e Lady
hath
noe fancie to marye with any Germane. There are appoin
ted
from hence to goe into
Scotland
to
e Baptisme of
e
Prince
M
ons
r
Brederode
e Elder, and
Mons
r
Valke
of
Zeeland.
For
at
your
L: maye desire to see a plotte of
is siege I endevoured longe
agoe
to sette one a worke, but it was not possible with anie safetie
to
e
workeman to doe yt, with anie perfitnes till our Artillerie was
thro-
ughly planted. Now
e inclosed is sent unto me, which is
done
somewhat sleightly, and in a small roome, without any tri
m
ing
for
at
e partie doth promise to send me a larger and exacter.
Howbeyt he doth assure me
at
e juste distance betweene ou
r campe
and
e Towne, the compasse,
e entrenchement, and
e leng
th of
e Towne with
e forme of
e Angels, portes and Bulwarkes,
together
with
e fortes, waters wayes, and such other generall thing
s in
at sorte as they present themselves towards our Campe, are se
tt down
in juste proportion, according to
e scale of passes joyned to
it
accounting two foote to a passe. Although it be no dra
ught
to content your L: yet for
at is
e first
at I have yet
seen
and is don by a skilfull person, who went it me hither in
a ruder
forme, I have caused it heere to be somewhat better draw
en
and I send it heerewith.
And thus for this present
I take
my humble leave. From
e Haghe July 10
